archetype_name: Family Low-Fat Mediterranean Light Plates (15–30, Mild)
name: Turkey Kofta with Bulgur Pilaf and Roasted Zucchini-Tomato
description: Lean turkey koftas seared on the stovetop, served with a quick herbed bulgur pilaf and a light oven-roasted zucchini and tomato side. Bright lemon and fresh herbs keep it Mediterranean and mild.
prep_steps: Heat oven to 220°C/425°F and line a sheet pan.
Cut 2 medium zucchini into half-moons and halve 2 cups cherry tomatoes.
Finely dice 1 small red onion (divide: half for kofta, half for pilaf).
Chop 1/2 cup parsley and 1/4 cup mint.
In a jug, combine 2 cups vegetable stock and bring to a simmer on the stovetop.
In a bowl, mix 500 g turkey with half the red onion, half the garlic, 1.5 tsp cumin, 1 tsp oregano, 1/2 tsp salt, 1/4 tsp black pepper, and 1 tbsp chopped parsley; form 8 small oval patties.
cook_steps: Toss zucchini and cherry tomatoes with 1 tsp olive oil, a pinch of salt, pepper, and a pinch of oregano; spread on the sheet pan and roast 15–18 minutes until tender.
For the pilaf, heat 1 tsp olive oil in a saucepan over medium; add remaining red onion and garlic and cook 2 minutes until softened.

Stir in 1 cup bulgur, toast 1 minute, then add the hot vegetable stock; bring to a simmer, cover, and cook 10–12 minutes until liquid is absorbed. Off heat, fluff and fold in remaining parsley and mint, plus half the lemon juiced.
While pilaf cooks, heat 2 tsp olive oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium; sear turkey koftas 3–4 minutes per side until browned and cooked through.
Plate bulgur, top with koftas, add roasted zucchini and tomatoes, and finish with remaining lemon wedges for squeezing. Adjust salt and black pepper to taste.
